text: Very good Chinese dumplings. Currently my best rating dumpling restaurant in Montreal. Although it cannot be compared with the best ones in China. Worth going.

I can't believe I've missed out on these dumplings this whole time!! Found them on yelp, drove over and parked my car and ordered 12 boiled dumplings! For 10$$$!! Also got it with spicy peanut butter sauce! I would just ask for more sauce next time!  Do your self a favour and go there! You see three older ladies with traditions in their hands making fresh dumplings you will be eating in no time!
A lovely addition to the neighbourhood. A small business - pretty much a hole in the wall - offering honest food. Word of mouth is making it often have lines, so it says something.

Miam!!! Les dumplings sont délicieux avec un choix de sauces maison au vinaigre, aux arachides ou au soya.  La soupe aux légumes était aussi très réconfortante: des légumes verts dans un bouillon de poulet bien goûteux.

Tried this place with some friends and weren't disappointed! We ordered a couple of the assortments (3 of of each of 4 kinds) and added an order of shrimp dumplings and 3 won ton soups. The dumplings were served with a peanut sauce and a vinegar-based sauce (soy-ginger type sauce often served with dumplings).   Overall, the dumplings were good and fresh. They are prepared on site and can be ordered freshly cooked or frozen to-go. Since we didn't specify how we wanted them cooked, we got one sampler order steamed and one pan-fried. I believe you can get them deep fried for an extra charge.  Also on the menu are salads: chinese mushroom salad, crushed cucumber, seaweed and bamboo shoot, and there is a small selection of Chinese pantry items in the shop.  The only thing I wish was that we could identify which dumplings were which in the sampler since they all looked similar, however, they were super yummy so not a big deal.   Happy to have this new addition on the Plaza and will definitely be back!

I walked in la Maison de Mademoiselle Dumpling the day it opened. I usually opt for getting frozen dumplings (which is not on the menu) and is tax in. There's a dope little window that showcases a wrapping queen. (2 weeks ago, there were 2 wrapping queens given how popular this dumpling joint has become).  When I do chose to eat in, they'll serve you unlimited hot tea. And I think some pickled dishes like they serve in Korean restaurants.  There's also a few shelves with some goodies from Japan (and Pocky for sure).  So good. Simple menu. Good tasting dumplings.

Excellent dumplings for a good price. You can tell that these are freshly made dumplings and you can see that as soon as you enter the restaurant with the employees working the dough.  I ordered the mixed boiled dumplings (dégustation) and it didn't disappoint. Each one was very tasty and good. They certainly compare to any dumpling restaurant around.

J'étais content de découvrir ce restaurant de dumplings proche de mon logement.   Étant un amateur de dumplings du Qing Hua et du Mai Xiang Yuan, j'étais donc excité.   La taille du restaurant est petit, environ 15 places. Il y a également un mur où on y vend des produits asiatiques, dont des kit-kat et oreo au matcha que je ne croyais qu'il n'avait pas à Montreal.   Le menu est moins grand que les autres restaurants de dumplings à Montréal, mais respectable. Les prix sont cependant plus chers.   J'ai pris un dumpling aux fruits de mer et un au porc et bok choy pour emporter. Ils étaient très bons. J'y retournerai certainement.  Côté sauces, ils ont 3 propositions (voir photos), mais je suis plus traditionnelle vinaigre+soya+piment.  Les dumplings sont bien faits et sont comparables aux autres restaurants, sauf pour ceux qui étaient poêlés que j'ai moins aimé, mais considérant que c'était pour emporter (quoique je mange souvent pour emporter), je laisse un doute.   Ce sera intéressant à faire découvrir à mes amis
Le menu dégustation et les dumplings szechuannais... Le paradis des dumplings, merci.

I heard about that place from the book "300 raisons d'aimer Montréal". I lived in MTL for a couple years but I didn't get the chance to try out this place until now.  I loved the dumplings, the cucumber salad and black mushroom salad too!  The only downside was that there wasn't much vegetarian friendly options! Or any "seafood" only dumplings! I guess that would've made it a 5 stars for me!  Will go back for sure!

Merci à Risa de m'avoir fait connaître ce restaurant. Il y a un moment que je cherche des dumplings fait à la main et végétariens dans le quartier Rosemont. J'y suis allée pour le take out. J'ai pris les dumplings tofu shitake et les dumplings aux légumes . Très savoureux avec choix de 3 sauces. Vous pouvez également les prendre vapeurs ou poêlés.

Nous sommes accros, nous y allons à peu près une fois par semaine. L'entrée de dumpling sichuanais est excellente, avec une sauce délicieuse alliant lait de coco, arachides et piment. La salade d'algues et bambou est aussi un succès (même si je rêve de portion de bambou plus grosse!). Et les dumplings sont toujours à point, aussi bons bouillis que poêlés.
C'est la place dans le quartier pour manger de délicieux dumplings bouillis ou rôtis! Deux dames s'affairent dans la vitrine à les concocter... À essayer et à adopter!

Ay OK! But not the best dumpling I've ever had. Great place to have lunch if you're in the area. It's pretty small, so you might wait in line, but if it's nice outside don't be scared to grab it as take-out.
